data.name: Salvation
data.description: Our version of India Pale Ale. Brewed with European malts and Northwest hops and then generously Dry Hopped with Cascade Hops for a nice citrus finish. Truly a Salvation for all Hop Heads.

style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

breweries.name: Atwater Brewery
breweries.description: Atwater Block Brewery, founded in 1997, is housed in a 1916 factory warehouse located in Detroit's historic Rivertown district. Brewing relentlessly on our imported Kaspar Schultz system, we've ridden the wave of aggressive ales while holding true to our German roots through our traditional Lagers. With drinkability and tradition at heart, it's easy for us to "Drink Our Share and Sell the Rest"!

data.name: Samuel Adams Dark Depths
data.description: Dark, and fierce, this English porter was transformed, from a mild ale to a dark and complex lager that confounds definition.   Immersed in dark, roasted malts and a bold citrus hop character, these big and contrasting flavors are brought together with the smoothness of a lager for a brew that’s rugged, mysterious, and full of flavor.
data.foodPairings: The bold hoppiness of this brew will balance the sharpness of an aged cheddar cheese, adding depth and complexity with its roasted character.

breweries.name: Boston Beer Company
breweries.description:
Today, we're a team of about 750 people, and we all share a common passion for bringing great Samuel Adams beers to beer lovers everywhere. We've worked hard and are incredibly proud of the many successes we've enjoyed over the years. The Boston Beer Company has been cited as one of the best companies to work for by Boston Magazine, one of the Best Entry-Level Jobs by The Princeton Review, and our beers have won more awards than any other in history. Jim has been named an "Entrepreneur of the Year" by Inc. Magazine. Our brewers keep amazing us with innovative new brews, including Samuel Adams Utopias and our Samuel Adams Barrel Room Collection.

Jim has believed from the beginning that the more you know and understand about beer, the more you'll appreciate a beer like Samuel Adams Boston Lager. To begin that mission, all new employees go through intensive training on everything from ingredients, brewing, and beer styles, to taking care of the beer once it leaves the brewery. We're all beer lovers and protectors of the beer so we're trained how to identify off flavors and how to troubleshoot the causes. The passion for beer continues with an annual homebrew competition that we all take part in.

One of our wholesalers once asked Jim why he invested so much in training his people, when ultimately they might leave. Jim smiled and replied without hesitation: "What if I didn't train them, and they stayed?"

Each year, usually in January, everyone gathers together. One of the highlights of the meeting is the beer trivia contest. With a culture so steeped in beer education and knowledge, winning is a pretty big deal. Recently, one of the hotel bartenders who was watching as the various teams arrived in costume with music and much enthusiasm and fanfare, said, "I've always known Samuel Adams made the best beer in America, but now I see this is the greatest company in America." When you look around you see that The Boston Beer Company is a team of enthusiastic people who are passionate about beer and who really love coming to work every day to provide American drinkers with the best beer possible.

The Boston Beer Company, Inc. is a publicly-traded company listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol, SAM.

data.name: Samuel Adams Latitude 48 IPA
data.description: Samuel Adams® Latitude 48 IPA is a unique IPA brewed with a select blend of hops from top German, English, and American growing regions all located close to the 48th latitude within the “hop belt” of the Northern Hemisphere.  The combination of hops in this beer creates a distinctive but not overpowering hop character.  The beer is dry hopped with Ahtanum, Simcoe®*, and East Kent Goldings hops for a powerful citrus and earthy aroma.  The hop character is balanced by a slight sweetness and full body from the malt blend.
data.foodPairings: Bring out the spice over the heat of buffalo wings with the hop character of a Samuel Adams® Latitude 48 IPA.

data.name: Samuel Adams Whitewater IPA
data.description: We love hops at Samuel Adams, and while we enjoy traditional IPAs, we thought we might spice things up a little bit, literally, by combining the intense hop character of an IPA with the crisp spicy wheat character of a Belgian-style white ale. The resulting fusion-style brew is Samuel Adams Whitewater IPA. The white ale and IPA combination make this crisp, smooth, yet hop-friendly beer the perfect pairing with a variety of meats and cheeses. Intensely flavored and firm in texture, Blue cheeses need a bold beer like Whitewater IPA to cleanse the palate. The brew's strong hop character also adds an earthiness to the savory flavor of meat.
data.foodPairings: Stimulate the spices of Cajun fare or Jamaican Jerk with the unique balance of intense hop and crisp spicy wheat character of Samuel Adams® Whitewater IPA.

data.name: San Diego IPA
data.description: One for the Homeland, our dangerously drinkable IPA will rouse the senses with overtones of pineapple from the notorious Nelson Hop followed by a resiny bitterness unique to the Chinook. Despite it’s high ABV, the San Diego IPA remains light bodied and refreshingly quaffable.

breweries.name: Latitude 33 Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Regardless of the people and events, however, Latitude 33 is always synonymous with “Adventure” — which is also our brewing philosophy. We’re on an exploration that involves taking a few risks, trying new things and injecting a little of the unexpected into the world of craft beer. If you’re up for it, we’d like to invite you to come along. Just meet us at Latitude 33.

data.name: San Juan IPA
data.description: A big and rugged American-style IPA like its namesake: the San Juan Mountains. It has a medium body and a firm, white, lasting head that clings to the glass. The beer is aggressively hopped and dry hopped. Four different varieties of American hops provide for a distinct citrus flavor. This beer finishes dry with grapefruit flavors that make you crave for more.

breweries.name: Ouray Brewery
breweries.description:
The Ouray Brewery is  open daily and offers seating on the only rooftop patio in the “Switzerland of America” — Ouray, Colorado. We also offer an intimate downstairs bar with 4 swings (you did read that right), a dining room on the mid-level of our pub and a mezzanine viewing area of our brew house.

We offer a full menu of juicy burgers,  fresh salads, apps and entrees. Try the Grilled Avocado Salad or our popular pulled pork sandwich.

Ouray has all the right ingredients — unspoiled scenery and water, a great local community and culture and close proximity to other great breweries. Come join us for a brew and a taste of all Ouray and Ouray Brewery have to offer.

breweries.name: Coronado Brewing Company
breweries.description:
When we opened the doors to our beach town brew pub on Coronado Island in
1996, we wanted it to be the kind of place where friends count enjoy great
beer, a good meal and a laid-back atmosphere.
Now, years later, our brewery’s a lot bigger and we’ve gotten a number of
awards. But we’re still following that same dream: brewing exceptionallly
balanced beer that’s authentically inspired by our West Coast roots. And
offering that experience to an ever-growing family that seeks an undeniable
coastal vibe, and shares our passion for great beer.
Welcome to Coronado Brewing Company. A Coastal Calling.

data.name: Sandy Eggo IPA
data.description: Brewed with English pale and crystal malts, kettle hop additions of the American varietals Simcoe, Columbus, Centennial and Amarillo from the Pacific Northwest are blended, then added four separate times. Two dry hop additions of the same hops are added post fermentation to brighten the hop flavor and aroma. Sharp piney hop flavors jump out in the aroma, followed by silky caramel and citrus peel. Hop flavors reminiscent of rosemary, grapefruit peel meld with caramel malt backbone. Makes for a truly euphoric West Coast style hop experience, hence the name.

breweries.name: Mad Fox Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Mad Fox Brewing Company offers a dining experience unique to the Washington, DC, area: upscale casual dining in an English-style gastro brewpub with an emphasis on high-quality food to complement our house-brewed beers.

Mad Fox features a chef-driven, seasonal menu and frequent specials including pizza, panini, salads and vegetarian friendly foods; fresh, locally grown seasonal produce, cheeses and other ingredients; locally raised lamb, bison, beef, chicken and game; and house-cured meats.

Mad Fox has a 63-foot long bar showcasing our seven to ten standard, house-brewed beers on tap as well as a rotating selection of seasonal brews in German, English, Belgian and American styles. Also, don’t miss our cask conditioned proper Real Ales served through water jacketed Angram beer engines, ensuring that every pint is served at properly conditioned cellar temperatures.

data.name: Sandy Mountain IPA
data.description: We teamed up with our pals from Black Mountain, NC's Pisgah Brewing to brew Sandy Mountain IPA, a collaboration between coastal folks and mountain folks. Simcoe was used liberally in both the boil and the dry hop, leaving citrus notes all over the place, from the nose to the back. The low ABV (to style) makes it easy to go back for another.

style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

breweries.name: Acorn Brewery of Barnsley
breweries.description:
Established in May 2003 by former chef Dave Hughes and his wife Judi, Acorn Brewery is located to the east of the Pennines in the village of Wombwell, Barnsley.

Having worked for Barnsley Brewery as Head Brewer for two years, Dave decided to go it alone, purchased a ten barrel brewplant from the Forester & Firkin brewpub in Stafford and moved it to premises in Wombwell.

 Following a lot of hard work by Dave and his assistant brewer Steve Bunting, and despite some initial set backs, the brewplant was commissioned and production of Acorn Brewery Barnsley Bitter began on 4th July 2003, using the same yeast strain as the original Barnsley Brewery, founded in the 1850's. Since then, sales have grown steadily and the range of beers has increased.

Acorn Brewery has developed a popular Yorkshire brand and is currently supplying over 300 free trade outlets and 3 national wholesalers.  

There are currently three award-winning beers permanently available, as well as regular seasonal brews.

breweries.name: Tree House Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Tree House Brewing Co. is an artisanal brewery located in a small red barn overlooking the Pioneer Valley in Monson, Massachusetts. We hand craft small batches of beer using well water and the finest ingredients available. Our goal is to make the best beer in the world at an exceptional value and without compromises. We hope to inspire friends and family, brothers and sisters, to share and enjoy our beer in the company of those they love - and to seek out like minded, passionate companies who are working on sustainable, local models that aim provide the customer with an exceptional drinking and culinary experience.

We think quality of life is less about the things you have and more about the experiences you enjoy and the friends you slow down and laugh with. This project is a natural extension of the simple life we aim to lead. We very much look forward to making friends with you along the way.

Founded by:

Dean Rohan, Jonathan Weisbach, Damien Goudreau, & Nathan Lanier

breweries.name: F.X. Matt Brewing Company
breweries.description: F.X. Matt Brewing Company is an American family-owned brewery at the foothills of the Adirondack Mountains in Utica, New York. It is the fourth oldest family-owned brewery in the United States after D. G. Yuengling & Son (1829), August Schell Brewing Company (1860), and Straub Brewery Inc. (1872). Its most popular product is the Saranac line of beers, although soft drinks such at Root Beer and Ginger Beer are also produced by the company.

data.name: Saranac Red IPA
data.description: Our Red IPA is a twist on a traditional west coast IPA featuring a deep red color from European dark caramel malts. We brew with generous amounts of American hops including Calypso, Palisade and Chinook to give this IPA a distinctive hop aroma. You'll notice a strong hoppy flavor with caramel malt undertones and a unique color that gives this IPA a whole new personality!

data.name: Saranac White IPA
data.description: Saranac White IPA is a tasty innovative twist on a traditional IPA.  We've taken a delicious American IPA bursting with Citra hops, and given it a whole new direction by adding the refreshing fruitiness of orange peel & coriander and the softening characters of wheat malt and oats.  You'll notice the complex hop flavor you've come to expect in an IPA, balanced with the extraordinary bright flavor of a wheat beer.  Cheers to twisting tradition!

breweries.name: Olde Peninsula Brewpub and Restaurant
breweries.description:
Olde Peninsula is a micro brewery and a full service pub and restaurant.      ? ?
Kalamazoo’s first brewpub, opened to the public on St. Patrick’s Day in 1996. Previously known as the “Bib Corner”, this location has an interesting historical past. Originally designed for the Peninsula restaurant, this three story structure was built by Nicholas Bauman in 1874.

This elegant restaurant gave way to the Franklin and Folz clothing store from 1884 to 1924. Through the years, the building housed a succession of businesses, including the Kalamazoo Stove company, a book bindery and a hotel.

It became the headquarters for W.R. Biggs/Gilmore Agency in 1973. Severely damaged by the 1980 tornado, the building was completely rehabilitated in 1980-81.

The current owners, Marie and Stephen Blinn, wish to bring back a piece of history for all of Kalamazoo to enjoy. We are proud to offer to you the freshest beer available, brewed on-site in our 7-barrel brew house.

breweries.name: Black Acre Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Black Acre Brewing Co. is a new small batch brewery located in Irvington, Indiana. The idea for Black Acre initially was conceived in 2010 due to our love of brewing, great beer, and the beer community at large. We created Black Acre with the goal of contributing delicious and unique beers to the community in which we live.

Black Acre hand crafts its ales using a custom fabricated 3 barrel electric brewing system. The brewery will produce four house beers along with an ever rotating selection of seasonal and specialty beers. Distribution will be primarily though in house tap room sales although there will be limited outside distribution. Our beers are not ready quite yet, but stop by for a glass of one of our delicious guest taps and meet the staff.

breweries.name: Foothills Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Foothills Brewing began in 2004 in Winston-Salem, NC, and has evolved into one of the top craft brewing operations in the southeast United States. Ranked among ratebeer.com’s 100 best breweries in the world, Foothills has garnered numerous awards for their beers, including seven Great American Beer Festival medals and three World Cup Beer medals, more than any other North Carolina-based brewery.

Foothills brews more than twenty year-round and seasonal offerings, including best sellers Hoppyum IPA and Carolina Blonde. Year-round brands also include People’s Porter, Torch Pilsner and Jade IPA; seasonals include Cottonwood Pumpkin and the highly anticipated Sexual Chocolate Imperial Stout. Foothills, Cottonwood and Carolina brands are distributed by a network of top-level distributors in North Carolina, South Carolina, Tennessee, Virginia, and Washington D.C.

breweries.name: Elysian Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Elysian was founded in 1995 by principals Dick Cantwell (President/Head Brewer), Joe Bisacca (CFO/Head of Operations) and David Buhler (Sales & Marketing Director). Our first Seattle location, a 220-seat beer hall and our main brewery, opened in 1996 on Capitol Hill, Seattle’s most populous neighborhood. In 1997 Elysian was chosen to operate a pub and small brewery at Gameworks—a large entertainment complex owned by Universal Studios, Dreamworks & Sega. Elysian left this partnership in 2002 upon expiration of the five-year contract. A short year later Elysian opened TangleTown, an 80-seat neighborhood brewery/bistro. With a 3-bbl pilot brewery, Elysian-TangleTown acted as the brewers' test kitchen, fueling the creative fires and helping cement Elysian's reputation as Seattle’s top brewpub. The most recent addition to the Elysian empire, Elysian Fields, opened in August 2006. Perched next to Seattle’s two sports arenas, Fields seats 400 and packs the house at lunch and on gamedays. It is typical for us to offer over twenty different Elysian beers between the three locations.

data.name: Saw Works / Terrapin 35th Parallel Ale
data.description: By now you’ve made the connection that Terrapin Beer Co. is located in Athens, GA, home to the University of Georgia. Likewise, Saw Works Brewing Co. is located in Knoxville, TN, home to the University of Tennessee and the hallowed Neyland Stadium. In spite of this SEC rivalry—and in spite of the larger brewhaha between the two states over the disputed border in Chattanooga—these two breweries will co-brew a batch of fine ale in celebration of comradery and football.

data.name: SB 150 IPA
data.description: Intense hop aroma with hints of sweet caramel, bready and grainy malts. Hops exclusively with Centennial hops, to give both a grapefruit and piney resin aroma and flavour. Flavour profile also has hints of light caramels and semi-sweet malts on the front of the palate. As it washes over the palate, distinct bitterness comes out that leaves the palate dry.

breweries.name: South Bend Brew Werks
breweries.description: Our mission is to “Build a stronger community, one brew at a time.” That means the community of brewers, of craft beer drinkers, of foodies, of local food producers, and of course, South Bend. We plan to celebrate and support South Bend, honoring its long heritage of brewing and food producing by making great beer and backing it up with locally sourced food. Sustainability is hard at work in South Bend and it’s a core tenet for us. Adaptive reuse is a philosophy we’re embracing fully and you’ll see it throughout our pub. We are fiercely proud of this city and it is an honor to have it as part of our name and be part of its renaissance.

data.name: Scale Tipper IPA
data.description: What's considered outrageous by most is what we call perfection. Big tropics is what we call Scale Tipper IPA , our most decorated achievement to date. Mosaic, El Dorado, Citra and Simcoe create one juicy and uniquely satisfying American IPA.

breweries.name: Odd Side Ales
breweries.description: ​Welcome to Odd Side Ales, one of the fastest growing breweries in Michigan. Born in an old piano factory in downtown Grand Haven, Michigan, Odd Side Ales first opened its doors in March 2010. We've grown steadily since that first brew, but have never lost sight of our initial goal: to create a variety of complex beers, each with its own unique flavor. To that end, we strive to craft unusual beers that will make your taste buds dance. Whether you're looking for the perfect IPA or something ... just a little different, we've got the beer for you.

Big Time's brewery is a 14 barrel JV Northwest system consisting of a gas fired brew kettle, an infusion mash tun with mixer, a hot liquor back, a wort cooler, (5) 14 barrel fermenters, (1) bright beer tank, and (20) 7 bbl serving tanks.  

We sell 85% of our beer at the pub but do wholesale a limited number of kegs to a dozen or so Seattle area taverns. We currently brew approximately 1,300 barrels of beer per year

breweries.name: The Saint Louis Brewery (Schlafly)
breweries.description:
Schlafly is the brand name of beers produced by the Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. Currently, all beers produced by this brewery are under the Schlafly brand. Located in St. Louis, Missouri, it is widely available in Eastern Missouri and Southern Illinois. Schlafly brand beers are distributed to the following states: Missouri, Kansas, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Tennessee, North Western Mississippi, North Virgina, and Washington, DC.

The Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. was incorporated in 1989. It was founded by Dan Kopman and Tom Schlafly,[1] a lawyer and nephew of political activist Phyllis Schlafly, although she is not involved with the brewery in any way. Their goal was to create quality local microbrew beer.

data.name: Scratch #12 2008
data.description:
In our never-ending pursuit of answering the burning question of whatÃ¢â?¬â?¢s new, we present Scratch #12-2008, an IPA.
 
The IPA is a fickle beast; too much malt and you veer into a high-octane hopbomb, while too little hops can question a beerÃ¢â?¬â?¢s virility. In these chaotic days of shrinking hop harvests, balance is key to a proper IPA. Scratch #12-2008 delivers an intense pine nose married with a subtle wildflower aroma. The Thames Valley yeast adds an earthy nod to traditional English IPAs, while the American hops provide a bold contrasting bitterness.
 
Breath deep, relax, enjoy.

breweries.name: Tröegs Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Tröegs Brewing Company was established in 1997 by brothers Chris and John Trogner. Since then, the Central PA natives have been handcrafting world-class beers that blend traditional brewing techniques with the innovation and eclecticism of the American craft brewing movement. Today, the Hershey, PA-based brewery produces six year-round beers (Hopback Amber Ale, Troegenator Double Bock, JavaHead Stout, Tröegs Pale Ale, DreamWeaver Wheat, and Perpetual IPA); four seasonal releases as part of the Hop Cycle series (Cultivator Helles Bock, Sunshine Pils, Hop Knife Harvest Ale, and Blizzard of Hops Winter IPA); and two limited beers (Nugget Nectar and Mad Elf Ale). 

In addition to these beers, Tröegs produces a variety of experimental, small batch beers as part of its Scratch Beer Series. These beers are available exclusively at the brewery and most are draft-only limited releases, although some popular Scratch Beers (Fresh Hop Ale, Fest Lager, etc.) are bottled for release through the General Store at the brewery. 

In late 2013, Tröegs introduced a special line of cork & cage bottle releases. The first, LaGrave, is available year-round. Master of Pumpkins was also released in 2013 and will continue with availability in the fall. Other beers such as Jovial have since followed suit. The addition of a canning line not only offers the brewery more flexibility in the way it presents its beers, but also allows Tröegs to provide customers with more packaging options. To date, Tröegs has released Perpetual IPA and Sunshine Pils in 12-ounce cans and Troegenator in 16-ounce cans. Plans to release other seasonal and limited beers in cans are currently in the works. 

The Splinter Series is an extremely limited line of barrel-aged beers packaged in cork & cage bottles. While only a handful of these beers have been produced, Tröegs plans to expand this series with the inclusion of Nebulous (barrel-aged LaGrave with Brett), bourbon barrel-aged Troegenator, and others. 

Tröegs currently distributes its beers throughout Delaware, Massachusetts, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Virginia and Washington D.C. In addition, Tröegs plans to expand into other New England markets in 2015.

Our state-of-the-art facility gives visitors a glimpse into the workings of a full production brewery by offering both guided tasting and self-guided tours. Our Tasting Room provides ample seating with views of the brewhouse, where you can sit back and enjoy one of our six year-round beers as well as a variety of seasonal and small-batch experimental brews. 

Our Snack Bar reflects our constant desire to explore, discover and share by focusing on fresh, simple fare that is locally sourced and house-made. With that in mind, we feature a seasonally rotating menu with daily chef’s specials.

www.troegs.com

data.name: Scratch #37 IPA (2011)
data.description:
Scratch #37 is the beginning of a journey into hops. After brewing Citra of Brotherly Love and Fresh Hop Ale we decided to do a little hop market research and see what makes our collective tongue tingle.

Scratch #37 features Warrior and Cluster hops with a touch of Columbus. It pours a bright gold with a white cap and soft carbonation. Ripe fruits are present on the nose, and continue in the flavor giving a lush tropical, papaya-like flavor. This ample bitterness is offset by sweet Munich malt that lingers through each taste.

Enjoy our latest IPA foray, and stay tuned for future experiments in the style. Research has rarely been so rewarding.

Hops: warrior, cluster, columbus hops

data.name: Scratch #39 IPA (2011)
data.description:
Scratch Series #39 is the third installment of our IPA mini-series, experimenting with yet another pair of hops—Simcoe and Palisade.

We’ve replicated the malt bill from #38, tweaking only the hops for this aggressive IPA. With an orange-amber body and off-white head, #39, drops brilliant in a glass. We have not filtered this beer to keep the hops as intense as possible. #39 screams a pine-citrus aroma courtesy of the intense Simcoe hops, and follows through with a blast of piney-flavor thanks to the Palisade hops. Just a touch of malt sweetness comes through.

Hops: Simcoe

style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale
style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

breweries.name: Tröegs Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Tröegs Brewing Company was established in 1997 by brothers Chris and John Trogner. Since then, the Central PA natives have been handcrafting world-class beers that blend traditional brewing techniques with the innovation and eclecticism of the American craft brewing movement. Today, the Hershey, PA-based brewery produces six year-round beers (Hopback Amber Ale, Troegenator Double Bock, JavaHead Stout, Tröegs Pale Ale, DreamWeaver Wheat, and Perpetual IPA); four seasonal releases as part of the Hop Cycle series (Cultivator Helles Bock, Sunshine Pils, Hop Knife Harvest Ale, and Blizzard of Hops Winter IPA); and two limited beers (Nugget Nectar and Mad Elf Ale). 

In addition to these beers, Tröegs produces a variety of experimental, small batch beers as part of its Scratch Beer Series. These beers are available exclusively at the brewery and most are draft-only limited releases, although some popular Scratch Beers (Fresh Hop Ale, Fest Lager, etc.) are bottled for release through the General Store at the brewery. 

In late 2013, Tröegs introduced a special line of cork & cage bottle releases. The first, LaGrave, is available year-round. Master of Pumpkins was also released in 2013 and will continue with availability in the fall. Other beers such as Jovial have since followed suit. The addition of a canning line not only offers the brewery more flexibility in the way it presents its beers, but also allows Tröegs to provide customers with more packaging options. To date, Tröegs has released Perpetual IPA and Sunshine Pils in 12-ounce cans and Troegenator in 16-ounce cans. Plans to release other seasonal and limited beers in cans are currently in the works. 

The Splinter Series is an extremely limited line of barrel-aged beers packaged in cork & cage bottles. While only a handful of these beers have been produced, Tröegs plans to expand this series with the inclusion of Nebulous (barrel-aged LaGrave with Brett), bourbon barrel-aged Troegenator, and others. 

Tröegs currently distributes its beers throughout Delaware, Massachusetts, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Virginia and Washington D.C. In addition, Tröegs plans to expand into other New England markets in 2015.

Our state-of-the-art facility gives visitors a glimpse into the workings of a full production brewery by offering both guided tasting and self-guided tours. Our Tasting Room provides ample seating with views of the brewhouse, where you can sit back and enjoy one of our six year-round beers as well as a variety of seasonal and small-batch experimental brews. 

Our Snack Bar reflects our constant desire to explore, discover and share by focusing on fresh, simple fare that is locally sourced and house-made. With that in mind, we feature a seasonally rotating menu with daily chef’s specials.

www.troegs.com

data.name: Scratch Beer 31 - 2010 Citra Of Brotherly Love IPA
data.nameDisplay: Scratch Beer 31 - 2010 Citra Of Brotherly Love IPA
data.description:
Scratch 31, the brothers and the brewers decided to revisit one of our favorite sweet spots Ã¢â?¬â?? IPA Ã¢â?¬â?? and have some fun with hop flavors. Dubbed Ã¢â?¬Ë?Citra of Brotherly LoveÃ¢â?¬â?¢ in honor of Philly Beer week, Scratch #31 has generous amounts of Apollo, Cascade and Citra hops. This is our first use of Citra hops, which is known for an intense grapefruit aroma and flavor.

While showcasing the intense Citra flavor we added additional bitterness with Apollo and Chinook hops as well. Scratch #31 went through a bed of Chinook hops in the hopback and was dry-hopped with Cascade and Citra hops.

breweries.name: Pub Dog Pizza & Drafthouse
breweries.description:
Pub Dog Pizza & Drafthouse opened in 2001 on Cross St. in the historic neighborhood of Federal Hill in Baltimore.  It immediately became a hit with neighborhood residents, suburbanites, and tourists alike.

Pub Dog quickly became famous for our gourmet personal-sized thin-crust pizzas, fresh salads, and "Dog Deal" beers - 2 mugs of our own house craft beer for one low price all the time.  

We developed a loyal late night following by serving food every night until 1:30 and staying open until 2:00AM every night.

Pub Dog expanded outside of the city in 2007, opening a location in Columbia.

Pub Dog began bottling some of our house beers for sale to go in 2007.  The bottles are now available at both pubs and in liquor stores around the state.

breweries.name: Comanche Creek Brewing Co
breweries.description: Comanche Creek Brewing Company is a small family owned microbrewery nestled in the Sangre de Cristo mountains of Northern New Mexico and located just out side Eagle Nest, New Mexico. Comanche Creek Brewing Company offers its take on several tradition beer styles including Alt and Kölsch styles. We utilize the pristine mountain waters of the Sangre de Cristo mountains to bring our customers great tasting beer. We hope you enjoy our hand-crafted beers the next time you are in Northern New Mexico!
